Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a picture of a healthy, growing plant with water and light.
The student can draw a picture of a plant that has no water and describe how it looks different.
The student can draw a picture of a plant that has no light and describe how it looks different.
The student can identify and illustrate that plants need both water and light to live and grow.
The student can use their drawings to explain patterns in how plants respond to changes in water and light.
